custom_item_1.info: absolutely necessary. Check to ensure these accounts have not been unlocked.
custom_item_1.sql_request: select USERNAME from DBA_USERS where ACCOUNT_STATUS not like '%LOCKED%' and USERNAME in ('ANONYMOUS','BI','CTXSYS','DBSNMP','DIP','DMSYS','EXFSYS','HR','IX','MDDATA','MDSYS','MGMT_VIEW','OE','OLAPSYS','ORDPLUGINS','ORDSYS','OUTLN','PM','SH','SI_INFORMTN_SCHEMA','SYS','SYSMAN','SYSTEM','WKPROXY','WKSYS','WK_TEST','WMSYS','XDB');

custom_item_2.description: 2.12 Third party default passwords - Set all default account passwords to non-default strong passwords
custom_item_2.info: When installed, some third-party applications create well-known default accounts in an Oracle Database.
custom_item_2.sql_request: select username from DBA_USERS_WITH_DEFPWD where username in (select username from DBA_USERS where ACCOUNT_STATUS='OPEN');

custom_item_3.info: WARNING: This will likely result in many applications failing and should not be enabled in production without thorough testing.
custom_item_3.sql_request: select value from v$parameter where name like 'sql92_security';

custom_item_4.info: privileges could get access to objects in the SYS schema. Default setting is FALSE.
custom_item_4.sql_request: select value from v$parameter where name like 'o7_dictionary_accessibility';

custom_item_5.description: 4.17 init.ora - Remove the following from spfile: dispatchers = (PROTOCOL=TCP) (SERVICE=XDB)
custom_item_5.info: recommended to disable these ports if production usage is not required.
custom_item_5.sql_request: select value from v$parameter where name like 'dispatchers';

custom_item_6.sql_request: select value from v$parameter where name like 'audit_sys_operations';

custom_item_7.description: 4.25 Accounts - Lock account access for application schema owners
custom_item_7.info: Lock the account for the application schema owner. Users must not connect to the database as the application owner.
custom_item_7.sql_request: select USERNAME from DBA_USERS where ACCOUNT_STATUS not like '%LOCKED%' and USERNAME not in ('ANONYMOUS','BI','CTXSYS','DBSNMP','DIP','DMSYS','EXFSYS','HR','IX','MDDATA','MDSYS','MGMT_VIEW','OE','OLAPSYS','ORDPLUGINS','ORDSYS','OUTLN','PM','SH','SI_INFORMTN_SCHEMA','SYS','SYSMAN','SYSTEM','WKPROXY','WKSYS','WK_TEST','WMSYS','XDB');

custom_item_8.info: exclusive, and logging of the administrative listener implemented.
custom_item_8.sql_request: select value from v$parameter where name like 'remote_login_passwordfile';

custom_item_9.info: Ensure the Oracle database is not returning complete database information to clients. Knowing the exact patch set can aid an attacker.
custom_item_9.sql_request: select value from v$parameter where name like 'sec_return_server_release_banner';

custom_item_10.description: 5.21 Encryption - Revoke the PUBLIC execute privileges from the DBMS_OBFUSCATION_TOOLKIT
custom_item_10.sql_request: select GRANTEE,PRIVILEGE from DBA_TAB_PRIVS where TABLE_NAME='DBMS_OBFUSCATION_TOOLKIT' AND PRIVILEGE='EXECUTE' AND GRANTEE='PUBLIC';

custom_item_11.description: 8.07 Database Profiles - Review accounts where password = 'EXTERNAL'
custom_item_11.info: Check and review any user who has password = 'EXTERNAL'. Do not allow remote OS authentication to the database.
custom_item_11.sql_request: select USERNAME from DBA_USERS where PASSWORD='EXTERNAL';

custom_item_12.description: 8.08 Database Profiles - Set password_verify_function to verification function
custom_item_12.sql_request: select PROFILE from DBA_PROFILES where RESOURCE_NAME='PASSWORD_VERIFY_FUNCTION' and LIMIT='NULL';

custom_item_13.description: 8.09 Database Profiles - Set cpu_per_session as appropriate
custom_item_13.info: that users profile settings have appropriate values set for the particular database and application.
custom_item_13.sql_request: select PROFILE from DBA_PROFILES where PROFILE in (select distinct PROFILE from DBA_USERS) and RESOURCE_NAME='CPU_PER_SESSION' and LIMIT='UNLIMITED';

custom_item_14.description: 8.10 Database Profiles - Set private_sga as appropriate
custom_item_14.info: Oracle database. Ensure that users profile settings have appropriate values set for the particular database and application.
custom_item_14.sql_request: select PROFILE from DBA_PROFILES where PROFILE in (select distinct PROFILE from DBA_USERS) and RESOURCE_NAME='PRIVATE_SGA' and LIMIT='UNLIMITED';

custom_item_15.description: 8.11 Database Profiles - Set logical_reads_per_session as appropriate
custom_item_15.info: database. Ensure that users profile settings have appropriate values set for the particular database and application.
custom_item_15.sql_request: select PROFILE from DBA_PROFILES where PROFILE in (select distinct PROFILE from DBA_USERS) and RESOURCE_NAME='LOGICAL_READS_PER_SESSION' and LIMIT='UNLIMITED';

custom_item_16.description: 8.12 Database Profiles - Set sessions_per_user as appropriate
custom_item_16.info: each individual user. Ensure that users profile settings have appropriate values set for the particular database and application.
custom_item_16.sql_request: select PROFILE from DBA_PROFILES where PROFILE in (select distinct PROFILE from DBA_USERS) and RESOURCE_NAME='SESSIONS_PER_USER' and LIMIT='UNLIMITED';

custom_item_17.description: 8.13 Database Profiles - Set connect_time as appropriate
custom_item_17.sql_request: select PROFILE from DBA_PROFILES where PROFILE in (select distinct PROFILE from DBA_USERS) and RESOURCE_NAME='CONNECT_TIME' and LIMIT='UNLIMITED';

custom_item_18.description: 8.14 Database Profiles - Set idle_time as appropriate
custom_item_18.sql_request: select PROFILE from DBA_PROFILES where PROFILE in (select distinct PROFILE from DBA_USERS) and RESOURCE_NAME='IDLE_TIME' and LIMIT='UNLIMITED';

custom_item_19.description: 9.01 Tablespaces - Do not have default_tablespace set to SYSTEM for user accounts
custom_item_19.info: difficult or impossible to move some objects.
custom_item_19.sql_request: select USERNAME from DBA_USERS where USERNAME not in ('SYS','SYSTEM','OUTLN','MGMT_VIEW') and DEFAULT_TABLESPACE='SYSTEM';

custom_item_20.info: db_extended. Allowing users to alter the AUD$ table can compromise the audit trail or integrity of the Oracle database.
custom_item_20.sql_request: select GRANTEE from DBA_TAB_PRIVS where TABLE_NAME='AUD$' and GRANTEE not in ('SYS','DBA');

custom_item_21.description: 9.28 Privileges - Prevent granting of all privileges 'GRANT ANY PRIVILEGE'
custom_item_21.info: The GRANT ALL PRIVILEGES must not be used; it gives full access to all tables, views and objects to the user or role it is granted to.
custom_item_21.sql_request: select GRANTEE from DBA_SYS_PRIVS where PRIVILEGE='GRANT ANY PRIVILEGE';

custom_item_22.description: 9.28 Privileges - Prevent granting of all privileges 'GRANT ANY OBJECT PRIVILEGE'
custom_item_22.info: The GRANT ALL PRIVILEGES must not be used; it gives full access to all tables, views and objects to the user or role it is granted to.
custom_item_22.sql_request: select GRANTEE from DBA_SYS_PRIVS where PRIVILEGE='GRANT ANY OBJECT PRIVILEGE';

custom_item_23.description: 9.52 Views - Revoke public access to all public views that start with 'ALL_'
custom_item_23.sql_request: select TABLE_NAME from DBA_TAB_PRIVS where table_name like 'ALL_%' and GRANTEE='PUBLIC';

custom_item_24.description: 9.54 Packages - Limit or deny access to 'DBMS_BACKUP_RESTORE'
custom_item_24.sql_request: select GRANTEE from DBA_TAB_PRIVS where TABLE_NAME='DBMS_BACKUP_RESTORE' and GRANTEE='PUBLIC';

custom_item_25.info: Abe revoked the applications that utilize DBMS_RANDOM are carefully audited.
custom_item_25.sql_request: select GRANTEE from DBA_TAB_PRIVS where TABLE_NAME='DBMS_RANDOM' and GRANTEE='PUBLIC';

custom_item_26.info: database via SQL (rather than through the application) from being able to enable the privileges associated with the role.
custom_item_26.sql_request: select ROLE from DBA_ROLES where password_required!='YES' and role not in ('AQ_ADMINISTRATOR_ROLE','AQ_USER_ROLE','AUTHENTICATEDUSER','CONNECT','CTXAPP','CWM_USER','DATAPUMP_EXP_FULL_DATABASE','DATAPUMP_IMP_FULL_DATABASE','DBA','DELETE_CATALOG_ROLE','EJBCLIENT','EXECUTE_CATALOG_ROLE','EXP_FULL_DATABASE','GATHER_SYSTEM_STATISTICS','GLOBAL_AQ_USER_ROLE','HS_ADMIN_ROLE','IMP_FULL_DATABASE','JAVADEBUGPRIV','JAVAIDPRIV','JAVASYSPRIV','JAVAUSERPRIV','JAVA_ADMIN','JAVA_DEPLOY','JMXSERVER','LOGSTDBY_ADMINISTRATOR','MGMT_USER','ORDADMIN','OEM_ADVISOR','OEM_MONITOR','OLAP_DBA','OLAPI_TRACE_USER','OLAP_XS_ADMIN','OWB_USER','OLAP_USER','RECOVERY_CATALOG_OWNER','RESOURCE','SCHEDULER_ADMIN','SELECT_CATALOG_ROLE','WKUSER','WM_ADMIN_ROLE','XDBADMIN','XDB_SET_INVOKER','XDB_WEBSERVICES','XDB_WEBSERVICES_WITH_PUBLIC','XDB_WEBSERVICES_OVER_HTTP');

custom_item_27.description: 13.03 Auditing - Audit all logons and logffs
custom_item_27.info: Auditing logon and logoff events may provide additional information for isolating the cause of security incidents.
custom_item_27.sql_request: select AUDIT_OPTION from DBA_STMT_AUDIT_OPTS where AUDIT_OPTION='CREATE SESSION' AND (SUCCESS!='BY ACCESS' AND FAILURE!='BY ACCESS');

custom_item_28.description: 13.04 Auditing - Audit for unsuccessful attempts. Audit by 'ACCESS WHENEVER NOT SUCCESSFUL' (check 'ALTER SYSTEM')
custom_item_28.info: access the table will be recorded. This could provide a record of unauthorized attempts to access sensitive data.

custom_item_75.description: 13.05 Auditing - Where appropriate or required by security or legal requirements, engage and use Fine-Grained Auditing (FGA) feature
custom_item_75.info: Note: The FGA record entry can be pre-qualified. Therefore, it should not add a significant burden to the size of audit records.
custom_item_75.sql_request: select ROWNUM from (select null from DBA_AUDIT_POLICIES union select null from DBA_AUDIT_POLICY_COLUMNS);

custom_item_76.description: 13.06 Auditing - Where appropriate or required by security or legal requirements, use enhanced capabilities of Fine-Grained Auditing.
custom_item_76.info: row from a table, or it could write to a different audit trail.
custom_item_76.sql_request: select ROWNUM from (select null from DBA_AUDIT_POLICIES union select null from DBA_AUDIT_POLICY_COLUMNS);

custom_item_77.info: Unauthorized table alters can results in application failures or be the precursor to an attack.
custom_item_77.sql_request: select AUDIT_OPTION from DBA_STMT_AUDIT_OPTS where AUDIT_OPTION='ALTER ANY TABLE' AND (SUCCESS!='BY ACCESS' OR FAILURE!='BY ACCESS');

custom_item_78.info: Unauthorized user alters can results in application failures, hijacked credentials, or be the precursor to an attack.

custom_item_93.description: 13.26 Auditing - Set 'AUDIT ALL' on SYS.AUD$ 'BY ACCESS';
custom_item_93.info: is set to DB or TRUE.
